revised_title: Causes of Oxygen Absorption in the Lungs During Rest and Exercise
tldr: The authors investigate the causes of oxygen absorption in the human lungs during rest and exercise. They find that under normal conditions, oxygen absorption is by diffusion alone. However, during muscular work or when breathing low-oxygen air, the lung epithelium is excited to secrete oxygen actively, indicating a new aspect of the physiology of mountain climbing, balloon ascents, and ordinary muscular work.
